Name: LM DOCKING
checklistText:
LM DOCKING

	LGC Power-Up (required)
	IMU Power-Up (LGC Operating)(required)
	DAP Data Load Routine (R03)(required)
	LGC monitoring thrust (required)
	COAS prepared for docking (required)

1.	Select RR displays:
	SHFT/TRUN sw - as desired
	RATE/ERR MON sw (1) - RNDZ RADAR
	X POINTER SCALE sw - HI MULT (as desired)
	RNG/ALT MON sw - RNG/RNG RT

2.	Select attitude control:
	Key V77E
	GUID CONT sw - PGNS
	S/C:
		ROLL, PITCH, YAW sw - MODE CONT
		PGNS sw - ATT HOLD
		AGS sw - ATT HOLD

3.	Enable ACA & TTCA
	TTCA/TRANSL sw (2) - ENABLE
	ACA/4 JETS sw (2) - ENABLE
	THROTTLE/JETS cont (2) - JETS
	ENG THR CONT:
		BAL CPL sw - ON
		ATT/TRANSL sw - 2 JETS
	ACA PROP sw (2) - ENABLE

4.	Select total attitude display:
	ORDEAL
		FDAI 1 sw - ORB RATE
		FDAI 2 sw - ORB RATE
	ATTITUDE MON sw (1) - PGNS
	ATTITUDE MON sw (1) - AGS

5.	Select attitude rate displays:
	RATE SCALE sw - as desired

6.	COAS - installed
	LTG: EXTERIOR LTG sw - DOCK
	Verify CMP has installed docking
	target.

7.	Radar technique:
	ACA - yaw & pitch, as required, to
	null shaft & trunnion angles on FDAI.
	TTCA - translate along X & Y
	body-axes to null LOS rates on
	X pointer ind (X pointer ind is
	fly-to display.)

	Translate along Z-body-axis to bring range rate to -5 fps.

8.	Monitor:
	Between range of 500 & 110 ft,
	maintain null of shaft & trunnion
	angles & LOS rates. Maintain range
	rate at -5 fps.

9.	TTCA - at 110 ft, translate to
	null range rate so that, at range
	of 80 ft, range rate is zero

10.	Select PGNCS attitue rate display:
	RATE/ERR MON sw - LDG RDR/CMPTR
	Key V60E

11.	ACA & TTCA - rotate & translate
	to acquire face-to-face orientation
	(LM Z-axis aligned with CSM X-axis
	and COAS aligned with docking tar-
	get) & null LOS & range rates

12.	Prepare for docking:
	RNDZ RADAR sel - SLEW
	SHFT/TRUN sw - +/- 50°
	RNDZ RADAR: SLEW LEFT or
	RIGHT to null trunnion
	RNDZ RADAR: SLEW  DOWN
	until shaft angle = 50°
	CB/AC BUS A: RNDZ RDR - open
	Install COAS in overhead window

13.	ACA - pitch down 90° & view CSM
	through overhead window

14.	ACA - yaw left at 120° until COAS
	reticle is aligned with CSM stand-
	off target.

Remarks:
	Yaw instructions are for head-to-
	head initial conditions (such as
	both vehicles heads down or heads
	up) before 90° pitch, after CSM roll
	(if any). For one vehicle heads up
	and other heads down, yaw right 60°.

15.	For CSM active docking, go to
	step 17.

16.	TTCA - make final approach along
	+X-axis.

17.	Before contact, set ROLL, PITCH, YAW sw - DIR

	At contact, apply +X-thrust.

18.	Terminate +X-thrust on receipt of
	capture verification

19.	If in minimum impulse:
	Key V77E

20.	Receive indication of docking-latch
	operation from CSM and/or by audi-
	ble & tactile cues.

21.	Maintain attitude control during retraction.

22.	S/C: PGNS sw - OFF

23.	LTG: FLOOD sw - OVHD/FWD

24.	Pressurize LM/CSM interlock

25.	LTG: EXTERIOR LTG sw - OFF
